newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - December 5.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Sri Lanka Newspapers - December 5.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Sri Lankan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

Poor transport could be major factor in high absenteeism at Colombo Port says committee appointed to improve productivity. Attendence of about 20 percent of operational labour is extremly unsatisfactory, says report.
Lawyers challenge appointment of Professor Shiranee Bandaranayake to Supreme Court.
Government bans boats from South India from entering Colombo port for security reasons. These vessels will be diverted to Galle in the south.

Police question a man suspected of belonging to the LTTE (Libertion Tigers of Tamil Eelam), who was at Colombo's Trans Asia Hotel where minister G.L. Peiris was to be the chief guest at an awards presentation of the state-owned Insurance Corporation. The minister did not attend for security reasons, organisers said.
LTTE blows up rail track in eastern Trincomalee district, wounding 12 civillians.
Police question a man claiming to be insurance agent from the northern Jaffna peninsula, found at a function due to be attended by senior cabinet minister G.L. Peiris.
President Kumratunga lends her support to government agencies fighting dengue fever. Today is dengue control day.
Lawyers file fundamental rights case against appointment of Professor Shiranee Bandaranayake to Supreme Court.
